text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Game Boy Advance is a portable console created by Nintendo in 2001. It has a color screen and 32-bit processor, but no 3D instructions. It is the most powerful portable console of the moment. Equipped with a 16 Mhz processor, an 8 Mhz GPU and 380 KB of RAM it displays a resolution of 240x160 in 511 colors. In 2003, Nintendo launched the GBA SP, with improvements such as a backlit screen, a reduced size, as well as a rechargeable lithium-ion battery. Finally in 2005, Nintendo released the Game Boy Micro, the latest version of its laptop.
